item.description:
FRI JAN 20 – The Mystery of Irma Vep with Connecticut Theatre Group *ADV TIX DISCOUNT*

The Mystery of Irma Vep by Charles Ludlam is one of the most produced comedies in US history; named one of 1984’s best plays by Time Magazine and the New York Times, it is a tribute to gothic horror films liberally stealing from well known film classics like The Mummy’s Curse and Hitchcock’s Rebecca.Literary detectives will also recognize dialog lifted from Ibsen, Shakespeare, and Poe.

“Irma” is a tour de force for Sean Harris and Rich Hollman who play all 8 characters racing through a quick change marathon complete with werewolves, vampires and damsels in distress.

Far and away the funniest two hours on a New York stage....What more meaningful gift could Ludlam bequeath [audiences] than to leave them eternally laughing." -The New York Times

"A true vaudeville tour de farce.... It's wonderful." –Time Magazine

THIS EVENT WILL SELL OUT - GET YOUR TICKET NOW

Pre-Party starts at 6:30pm - Show starts at 8pm FREE SAFE PARKING

**RECEIVE A 15% DISCOUNT ON FOOD AND DRINK AT THE PRE-PARTY WITH YOUR TICKET **PLUS JOIN US IN PLAYHOUSE ON PARK BEFORE THE SHOW FOR A COMPLIMENTARY WINE AND CHEESE PARTY**

Advance Tickets are $25 * Tickets are $30 at the event

Playhouse on Park
244 Park Road
West Hartford, CT 06119

 EXIT 43 PARK ROAD off 84 * Next to AC Petersons

Pick up your ticket before the show at the pre-Party with the Connecticut Theatre Group, or at the will call window

WE HAVE A VERY LIMITED NUMBER OF TICKETS IN THE CONNECTICUT THEATRE GROUP SECTION * THIS EVENT WILL SELL OUT - GET YOUR TICKET NOW

Visit http://www.CTTheatre.org or call (860) 987-7888
